intro: Sebaea elongata, commonly known as the longleaf sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a follicle containing seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. Sebaea elongata is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions.
